summary: Sheffield is a big city in England, named after the River Sheaf. It's known for its green spaces, being in the Pennines foothills, and having over 250 parks. The city grew a lot during the Industrial Revolution because of its steel and cutlery industries. It has a rich history in sports, with the world's oldest football club and ground. Today, Sheffield is still an important city, with a growing economy and a population of around 556,500 people.
title: Sheffield
